column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Have you had much to do with Wikinews during the course of your work for the Wikimedia Foundation ?
#Text=No , very little .
#Text=I am a big supporter of Wikinews for obvious reasons .
#Text=Can I talk a little bit about that ?
#Text=Sure .
#Text=I am very interested in Wikinews because of my background .

#Text=I worked for seven years in online journalism , and spent a lot of time talking with my colleagues at other organizations about the future of online news , citizen journalism , participatory journalism etc.

#Text=I am still doing some of that — next week , for example , I will be in Washington helping the Corporation for Public Broadcasting decide who to give funding for to cover the US presidential election online .
#Text=So I am very interested in these issues .
#Text=And I do n't think that any media organization has got this figured out , even a little bit .

#Text=It seems to me that Wikinews is in a very good position to make real progress on participatory news/citizen journalism , etc. , because the WMF projects are extremely good at fostering collaboration .
#Text=So I am watching Wikinews with a lot of interest .
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=I am really hoping that someone applying for funds from the CPB will propose a collaboration with Wikinews
#Text=When the Foundation moves to San Fransisco [ sic ] , will you be going with it ?
#Text=Yes
#Text=Do you believe that citizen journalism sites like Wikinews should have an editorial review process ?
#Text=That is a good question .
#Text=I assume you mean prepublication , right ?
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=It 's a good question , and there are good arguments on both sides .

#Text=I know that Nick Denton of Gawker Media has a kind of ' shoot first ask questions later ' stance — they say they value transparency and are fine to admit their mistakes and publish corrections immediately .
#Text=I think in general that 's the direction the media are moving in ; that we would publish and correct , rather than hold off publishing .
#Text=There are lots of reasons for that , and there 's an interesting argument to be made that it 's the most respectful stance vis-a-vis the readers .
#Text=Gawker sounds like what we do , only a lot less cautious .
#Text=Yes .
#Text=I like Nick Denton a lot — he is very honest and modest about the work he does .
#Text=He sometimes mocks traditional media for being overly pompous
#Text=Sue , the community initiative " Conference of the Americas " is getting support from Turner Broadcasting for the citizen journalism unconference .
#Text=How do you feel about the community partnering with such a big name in journalism ?
#Text=I do n't know anything about that particular proposal for collaboration , but I am generally very much in favour of us collaborating with external entities .
#Text=I have begun talking a little with a guy at CNN myself , as I think Brian knows .
